original: @294a // sems kyi nyams cung zad tsam zhig mdor bsdus te brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: @294a // sems kyi nyams cung zad tsam zhig mdor bsdus te brjod par bya'o //
translated: I will briefly describe some of the experiences of mind.

original: de la mtshan ma dang bcas pa'i rnal 'byor dang / mtshan ma med pa'i rnal 'byor rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de la mtshan ma dang bcas pa'i rnal 'byor dang / mtshan ma med pa'i rnal 'byor rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: There are two kinds of yoga: yoga with signs and yoga without signs.

original: de la mtshan ma dang bcas pa'i rnal 'byor bshad pa'i dbang du byas nas chos brgyad shes shing ldan na mtshan ma dang bcas pa'i dmigs pa la gtad du 'dod par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de la mtshan ma dang bcas pa'i rnal 'byor bshad pa'i dbang du byas nas chos brgyad shes shing ldan na mtshan ma dang bcas pa'i dmigs pa la gtad du 'dod par 'gyur te /
translated: In terms of explaining the yoga with signs, if one knows and possesses the eight dharmas, one will wish to focus on the object with signs.

original: chos brgyad ni zhi gnas kyi rgyu drug dang ldan par bya ba dang / dbyibs dang kha dog gi mtshan nyid shes par bya ba dang / gtso cher spyi la bsgom par ba zhing //
analyzed: chos brgyad ni zhi gnas kyi rgyu drug dang ldan par bya ba dang / dbyibs dang kha dog gi mtshan nyid shes par bya ba dang / gtso cher spyi la bsgom par ba zhing //
translated: The eight dharmas are the six causes of śamatha, possessing the characteristics of shape and color, and mainly meditating on the general.

original: bye brag la gnas kyi bar du bye brag la gzhag par bya ba dang / dmigs pa shin tu gsal ba bsgom par ba dang / bying rgod gnyis kyi dbang du mi gtang ba dang / bsgom pa tshod zin par bya ba dang / rgyu chos de drug yid la bzhag ste bsgoms pas 'bras bu sems bskyed pa'i rim pa mu bzhir rig par bya ba dang /
analyzed: bye brag la gnas kyi bar du bye brag la gzhag par bya ba dang / dmigs pa shin tu gsal ba bsgom par ba dang / bying rgod gnyis kyi dbang du mi gtang ba dang / bsgom pa tshod zin par bya ba dang / rgyu chos de drug yid la bzhag ste bsgoms pas 'bras bu sems bskyed pa'i rim pa mu bzhir rig par bya ba dang /
translated: In particular, one should practice in a place that is suitable, in a suitable time, in a suitable posture, with a suitable attitude, with a suitable object, and with a suitable mental attention.

original: mu gsum pa'i dus su ma nges pa rnam pa lnga'i rjes su 'brang bar bya ba ma yin pa'o //🔽de la zhi gnas kyi rgyu drug dang ldan par bya ba ni mthun pa'i yul na gnas pa dang / 'dod pa chung ba dang / chog shes pa dang / bya ba mang po spang pa dang / tshul khrims rnam par dag par bya ba dang /
analyzed: mu gsum pa'i dus su ma nges pa rnam pa lnga'i rjes su 'brang bar bya ba ma yin pa'o // de la zhi gnas kyi rgyu drug dang ldan par bya ba ni mthun pa'i yul na gnas pa dang / 'dod pa chung ba dang / chog shes pa dang / bya ba mang po spang pa dang / tshul khrims rnam par dag par bya ba dang /
translated: One should not follow the five kinds of uncertainty at the time of the third stage.

original: 'dod pa la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa spang ba'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa spang ba'o //
translated: The six causes of serenity are: to live in a conducive place, to have few desires, to be content, to abandon activities, to purify morality, and to abandon discursive thought.

original: zhi gnas kyi rgyu drug shes par byas nas rgyud la ldan par bya'o //
analyzed: zhi gnas kyi rgyu drug shes par byas nas rgyud la ldan par bya'o //
translated: Having understood the six causes of serenity, one should possess them in one's stream of consciousness.

original: dbyibs dang kha dog gi mtshan nyid shes par bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku la dmigs pa gtod pa yin na dbyibs kyi mtshan nyid ni stod smad la sogs pa'i bye brag ji ltar gnas pa bzhin du shes par bya ba dang / kha dog gi mtshan nyid ni kha dog rnam pa bzhi las ji ltar gnas pa bzhin du shes par bya'o //
analyzed: dbyibs dang kha dog gi mtshan nyid shes par bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku la dmigs pa gtod pa yin na dbyibs kyi mtshan nyid ni stod smad la sogs pa'i bye brag ji ltar gnas pa bzhin du shes par bya ba dang / kha dog gi mtshan nyid ni kha dog rnam pa bzhi las ji ltar gnas pa bzhin du shes par bya'o //
translated: As for the knowledge of the characteristics of shape and color, if one focuses on the body of the Tathagata, one should know the characteristics of shape, such as the distinctions of upper and lower parts, just as they are, and one should know the characteristics of color, such as the four colors, just as they are.

original: gtso cher spyi la bsgom par bya zhing /
analyzed: gtso cher spyi la bsgom par bya zhing /
translated: One should cultivate the general image, and🔽one should focus on the particulars until one is able to.

original: bye brag la gnas kyi bar du bye brag la @294b gzhag par bya ba ni dbyibs dang kha dog gi mtshan nyid shes par byas nas bsgom pa'i dus na sku rdzogs pa'i ngo bo spyi la sems gtad par bya ste /
analyzed: bye brag la gnas kyi bar du bye brag la @294b gzhag par bya ba ni dbyibs dang kha dog gi mtshan nyid shes par byas nas bsgom pa'i dus na sku rdzogs pa'i ngo bo spyi la sems gtad par bya ste /
translated: Having understood the characteristics of shape and color, when one meditates, one should focus the mind on the general image of the complete body.

original: de ltar gtad tsam na rdzogs pa mi snang bar bye brag phyogs 'ga' snang na ji tsam snang gi bar du bye brag de la sems gtad par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar gtad tsam na rdzogs pa mi snang bar bye brag phyogs 'ga' snang na ji tsam snang gi bar du bye brag de la sems gtad par bya'o //
translated: Thus, when you direct your attention in this way, if the complete image does not appear, but only a few of the details appear, then you should direct your attention to those details, and you should continue to do so for as long as they appear.

original: de bas na gtso cher spyi la bsgom par bya zhing bye brag la gnas kyi bar du bye brag la gzhag par bya ba yin te /
analyzed: de bas na gtso cher spyi la bsgom par bya zhing bye brag la gnas kyi bar du bye brag la gzhag par bya ba yin te /
translated: Therefore, you should cultivate the general image primarily, and you should direct your attention to the details only to the extent necessary to stabilize your attention.

original: de ltar ma yin pa'i dmigs par bya ba'am /
analyzed: de ltar ma yin pa'i dmigs par bya ba'am /
translated: You should not make the details the object of your attention,

original: mdun du bzhag nas dus rtag tu har sgom byed pa'am //
analyzed: mdun du bzhag nas dus rtag tu har sgom byed pa'am //
translated: or place them in front of you and meditate on them continuously,

original: sku'i bye brag rim gyis yid la byed pa 'am /
analyzed: sku'i bye brag rim gyis yid la byed pa 'am /
translated: or bring the details to mind in sequence,

original: bye brag phyogs 'ga' la mi snang ba bzhin du don dang ched du gtod pa ni dmigs pa myur du mi thob pa'i rgyu yin par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: bye brag phyogs 'ga' la mi snang ba bzhin du don dang ched du gtod pa ni dmigs pa myur du mi thob pa'i rgyu yin par shes par bya'o //
translated: or direct your attention to the details that do not appear. You should understand that these are causes for not quickly attaining attention.

original: dmigs pa shin tu gsal bar bsgom par bya ba ni gtso cher spyi la bsgom pa'i dus na yod do snyam pa dang / gnag yo re ba tsam dang / rab rib tsam du bsgom pa ma yin te /
analyzed: dmigs pa shin tu gsal bar bsgom par bya ba ni gtso cher spyi la bsgom pa'i dus na yod do snyam pa dang / gnag yo re ba tsam dang / rab rib tsam du bsgom pa ma yin te /
translated: You should cultivate the object of meditation with very clear images. This is not like cultivating a vague image or an image that is as unclear as if you were looking at something through a veil.

original: dbyibs dang kha dog gi mtshan nyid shin tu gsal bar bsgoms pa'i stobs kyis phyis dmigs par bya ba shin tu gsal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: dbyibs dang kha dog gi mtshan nyid shin tu gsal bar bsgoms pa'i stobs kyis phyis dmigs par bya ba shin tu gsal bar 'gyur te /
translated: By the power of meditating on the characteristics of shape and color very clearly, later the object of meditation becomes very clear.

original: de bas na dmigs pa shin tu gsal bar bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na dmigs pa shin tu gsal bar bsgom par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, you should meditate on a very clear object of meditation.

original: bying rgod kyi dbang du gtang bar bya ba ma yin pa ni dmigs pa shin tu gsal bar sgom pa'i dus na bying rgod gnyis kyi dbang du btang nas bsgom pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: bying rgod kyi dbang du gtang bar bya ba ma yin pa ni dmigs pa shin tu gsal bar sgom pa'i dus na bying rgod gnyis kyi dbang du btang nas bsgom pa ma yin gyi /
translated: You should not be carried away by laxity and excitement means that when you meditate on a very clear object of meditation, you should not meditate while being carried away by either laxity or excitement.

original: de bas na bying na gzengs bstod cing rgod na blan par bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na bying na gzengs bstod cing rgod na blan par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, if you are lax, you should arouse your mind; if you are excited, you should calm your mind.

original: sgom pa tshod zin par bya ba ni khams rab 'bring tha ma gsum las rab kyis ni nyin gyi bzhi cha mtshan gyi bzhi cha bsgom par bya ste /
analyzed: sgom pa tshod zin par bya ba ni khams rab 'bring tha ma gsum las rab kyis ni nyin gyi bzhi cha mtshan gyi bzhi cha bsgom par bya ste /
translated: You should meditate in proper measure means that among the three types of faculties—superior, medium, and low—those of superior faculties should meditate for one quarter of the day and one quarter of the night.

original: nyin gyi bzhi cha ni thun bzhi 'am lnga bsgom par bya /🔽mtshan gyi bzhi cha ni srod tho rangs la bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: nyin gyi bzhi cha ni thun bzhi 'am lnga bsgom par bya /🔽mtshan gyi bzhi cha ni srod tho rangs la bsgom par bya'o //
translated: One quarter of the day should be spent in four or five meditation sessions.🔽One quarter of the night should be spent in meditation at dusk and at dawn.

original: 'bring gis ni nyin 'ba' zhig gi bzhi cha bsgom par bya ste /
analyzed: 'bring gis ni nyin 'ba' zhig gi bzhi cha bsgom par bya ste /
translated: The medium person should meditate for one quarter of the day.

original: mtshan gyi btang snyoms su bzhag cing nyin bar gyi bzhi cha la thun lnga'am drug tu bsgom par bya'o //🔽tha mas ni nyin 'ba' zhig gi lnga cha 'am drug cha 'am /
analyzed: mtshan gyi btang snyoms su bzhag cing nyin bar gyi bzhi cha la thun lnga'am drug tu bsgom par bya'o // tha mas ni nyin 'ba' zhig gi lnga cha 'am drug cha 'am /
translated: He should rest in equanimity during the night and meditate in five or six sessions during the day.🔽The inferior person should meditate for one quarter, one third, or one half of the day.

original: bdun cha tsam bsgom par bya ste mtshan mo btang snyoms su gzhag cing /
analyzed: bdun cha tsam bsgom par bya ste mtshan mo btang snyoms su gzhag cing /
translated: He should rest in equanimity during the night and meditate in five or six sessions during the day.🔽The inferior person should also be understood as having three types: superior, medium, and inferior.

original: khams tha mas kyang rab 'bring tha ma gsum du shes par byas nas nyin gyi lnga cha dang drug cha dang bdun cha la thun drug gam bdun du bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: khams tha mas kyang rab 'bring tha ma gsum du shes par byas nas nyin gyi lnga cha dang drug cha dang bdun cha la thun drug gam bdun du bsgom par bya'o //
translated: The superior person should meditate for one half, one third, or one quarter of the day.

original: de la bsgom pa'i dus ni thung la mi bsgom pa'i dus ni ring bas dmigs pa gtad du mi 'dod par 'gyur ro snyam du sems na /
analyzed: de la bsgom pa'i dus ni thung la mi bsgom pa'i dus ni ring bas dmigs pa gtad du mi 'dod par 'gyur ro snyam du sems na /
translated: If you think, “The time of meditation is short and the time of nonmeditation is long, so I do not want to focus on the object,”

original: sgom pa yun thung yang shin tu gsal ba'i stobs kyis bag chags 'jog nus par 'gyur la mi @295a * //
analyzed: sgom pa yun thung yang shin tu gsal ba'i stobs kyis bag chags 'jog nus par 'gyur la mi @295a * //
translated: then although the meditation is short, it can be powerful and able to plant the latent tendencies because it is very clear.

original: sgom pa'i dus ring yang g-yel ba gzhan ma byas pas snga ma'i bag chags kyang mthu chung bar mi 'gyur la sgom pa yun thung ba'i dbang gis shes pa'i rgyud nas nus pa che bar gyur nas /
analyzed: sgom pa'i dus ring yang g-yel ba gzhan ma byas pas snga ma'i bag chags kyang mthu chung bar mi 'gyur la sgom pa yun thung ba'i dbang gis shes pa'i rgyud nas nus pa che bar gyur nas /
translated: By the power of the short duration of the meditation, the potency becomes great in the stream of consciousness.

original: shin tu gsal bar bsgoms pa'i stobs kyis dmigs pa la gtad du 'dod pa myur du 'thob par 'gyur ro //🔽rgyu chos de drug yid la bzhag nas bsgoms pas 'bras bu sems skye ba'i rim pa mu bzhir rig par bya ste chos drug ni zhi gnas kyi rgyu drug dang ldan par bya ba la sogs pa'i chos drug shes shing ldan nas bsgoms pa'i stobs kyis sems skye
analyzed: shin tu gsal bar bsgoms pa'i stobs kyis dmigs pa la gtad du 'dod pa myur du 'thob par 'gyur ro // rgyu chos de drug yid la bzhag nas bsgoms pas 'bras bu sems skye ba'i rim pa mu bzhir rig par bya ste chos drug ni zhi gnas kyi rgyu drug dang ldan par bya ba la sogs pa'i chos drug shes shing ldan nas bsgoms pa'i stobs kyis sems skye
translated: By the power of the meditation with great clarity, one quickly obtains the desire to direct the mind to the object.🔽The result of the arising of the mind is to be known as the four alternatives of the process of the arising of the mind, by keeping in mind and meditating on those six causes.

original: ba'i rim pa mu bzhi 'byung ste /🔽mu dang po la ni rtsol ba drag tu bsgoms kyang dmigs par bya ba mi snang la /
analyzed: ba'i rim pa mu bzhi 'byung ste / mu dang po la ni rtsol ba drag tu bsgoms kyang dmigs par bya ba mi snang la /
translated: The four alternatives of the process of the arising of the mind occur by the power of the meditation with the knowledge and possession of the six dharmas, which are the six causes of calm abiding.🔽In the first alternative, although one meditates with intense effort, the object of meditation does not appear.

original: rtsol ba zhan du bsgoms kyang dmigs par bya ba mi snang ba yin no //
analyzed: rtsol ba zhan du bsgoms kyang dmigs par bya ba mi snang ba yin no //
translated: In the second alternative, although one meditates with weak effort, the object of meditation does not appear.

original: mu gnyis pa la ni rtsol ba drag tu bsgoms na gnas skabs kha cig tu snang la /
analyzed: mu gnyis pa la ni rtsol ba drag tu bsgoms na gnas skabs kha cig tu snang la /
translated: In the second alternative, if you meditate with intense effort, it will appear in some situations.

original: gnas skabs kha cig tu ni drag zhan gnyis ka la yang mi snang ba yin no //
analyzed: gnas skabs kha cig tu ni drag zhan gnyis ka la yang mi snang ba yin no //
translated: In some situations, it will not appear in either the intense or weak forms.

original: mu gsum pa la ni rtsol ba drag tu bsgoms na snang la /
analyzed: mu gsum pa la ni rtsol ba drag tu bsgoms na snang la /
translated: In the third alternative, if you meditate with intense effort, it will appear.

original: zhan du bsgoms na mi snang ba yin no //
analyzed: zhan du bsgoms na mi snang ba yin no //
translated: If you meditate weakly, it will not appear.

original: mu bzhi pa ni mu gsum pa las khyad par du gyur pa yin te /
analyzed: mu bzhi pa ni mu gsum pa las khyad par du gyur pa yin te /
translated: The fourth alternative is distinguished from the third in that

original: rtsol ba drag zhan gnyis ka la yang snang la thun rkyang bar yang nus /
analyzed: rtsol ba drag zhan gnyis ka la yang snang la thun rkyang bar yang nus /
translated: it appears in both intense and weak forms of meditation and can be done in a single session.

original: mi mthun pa'i chos gnyis dang bral zhing mthun pa'i chos gsum dang ldan pa yin te /
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i chos gnyis dang bral zhing mthun pa'i chos gsum dang ldan pa yin te /
translated: It is free from two incompatible qualities and possesses three compatible qualities.

original: mi mthun pa'i chos ni rgod pa rgyun chags dang / bying ba shas che ba yin la /
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i chos ni rgod pa rgyun chags dang / bying ba shas che ba yin la /
translated: The incompatible qualities are continuous excitation and a preponderance of laxity.

original: mthun pa'i chos gsum ni tshor ba dga' ba de'i phyogs dang mthun pa dang / zhi gnas kyi phyogs dang mthun pa yin no //
analyzed: mthun pa'i chos gsum ni tshor ba dga' ba de'i phyogs dang mthun pa dang / zhi gnas kyi phyogs dang mthun pa yin no //
translated: The three compatible qualities are the feeling that is compatible with that joy and the feeling that is compatible with serenity.

original: yang chos drug yid la bzhag nas bsgoms pas sems kyi skye ba'i rim pa mu bzhir shes par bya ba ni /
analyzed: yang chos drug yid la bzhag nas bsgoms pas sems kyi skye ba'i rim pa mu bzhir shes par bya ba ni /
translated: Furthermore, by meditating on the mind while keeping in mind the six topics, one should understand the four possibilities of the process of the arising of the mind.

original: mu dang po ni rtsol ba drag zhan gnyis ka la yang snang la /
analyzed: mu dang po ni rtsol ba drag zhan gnyis ka la yang snang la /
translated: The first possibility is that it appears in both strong and weak efforts.

original: gnas skabs kha cig tu ni rtsol ba drag zhan gnyis ka la mi snang ba yin no //
analyzed: gnas skabs kha cig tu ni rtsol ba drag zhan gnyis ka la mi snang ba yin no //
translated: In some situations, it does not appear in either strong or weak efforts.

original: mu gnyis pa la ni mu dang po las khyad par du gyur pa yin te /
analyzed: mu gnyis pa la ni mu dang po las khyad par du gyur pa yin te /
translated: The second possibility is distinguished from the first possibility.

original: rtsol ba drag zhan gnyis ka la yang snang ba'i grangs ni mang la /
analyzed: rtsol ba drag zhan gnyis ka la yang snang ba'i grangs ni mang la /
translated: The number of appearances in both strong and weak efforts is many.

original: mi snang ba'i grangs ni nyung ba yin no //
analyzed: mi snang ba'i grangs ni nyung ba yin no //
translated: The number of non-appearances is few.

original: mu gsum pa la ni rtsol ba drag zhan gnyi ga la yang snang la /
analyzed: mu gsum pa la ni rtsol ba drag zhan gnyi ga la yang snang la /
translated: The third possibility is that it appears in both strong and weak efforts.🔽In some situations, it does not appear when one meditates with weak effort.

original: gnas skabs kha cig tu ni rtsol ba zhan du bsgoms na mi snang ba yang yin la yang na kha cig gi dbang du byas na ma nges pa rnam pa lngar snang ste /
analyzed: gnas skabs kha cig tu ni rtsol ba zhan du bsgoms na mi snang ba yang yin la yang na kha cig gi dbang du byas na ma nges pa rnam pa lngar snang ste /
translated: Or, in some cases, it appears in five ways that are not definite.

original: ma nges pa rnam pa lnga ni dbyibs ma nges pa dang / kha dog ma nges pa dang / kha dog 'ba' zhig snang ba dang / grangs ma nges pa dang / che chung ma nges pa'o //
analyzed: ma nges pa rnam pa lnga ni dbyibs ma nges pa dang / kha dog ma nges pa dang / kha dog 'ba' zhig snang ba dang / grangs ma nges pa dang / che chung ma nges pa'o //
translated: The five kinds of uncertainty are uncertainty about shape, uncertainty about color, uncertainty about the appearance of color alone, uncertainty about number, and uncertainty about size.

original: de la dbyibs ma nges pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku'i dbyibs @295b dang ; kha dog gi mtshan nyid snang bar 'dod pa la mchod rten gyi dbyibs 'dra ba dang / zlum zlum po lta bur snang ba yin no //
analyzed: de la dbyibs ma nges pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku'i dbyibs @295b dang ; kha dog gi mtshan nyid snang bar 'dod pa la mchod rten gyi dbyibs 'dra ba dang / zlum zlum po lta bur snang ba yin no //
translated: Uncertainty about shape is when one wishes to see the shape and color of the Tathagata's body, but sees something like the shape of a stupa or a round shape.

original: kha dog ma nges pa ni ser por snang bar 'dod pa la dkar po dang sngon po lta bur snang ba yin no //
analyzed: kha dog ma nges pa ni ser por snang bar 'dod pa la dkar po dang sngon po lta bur snang ba yin no //
translated: Uncertainty about color is when one wishes to see a color as yellow, but sees it as white or blue.

original: kha dog 'ba' zhig snang ba ni dbyibs dang kha dog gi mtshan nyid bcas par 'dod pa las dbyibs med par kha dog snang ba yin no //
analyzed: kha dog 'ba' zhig snang ba ni dbyibs dang kha dog gi mtshan nyid bcas par 'dod pa las dbyibs med par kha dog snang ba yin no //
translated: Uncertainty about the appearance of color alone is when one wishes to see both the shape and color, but sees only the color without the shape.

original: grangs ma nges pa ni dmigs par bya ba gcig kho nar snang bar 'dod pa la lnga 'am drug tu snang ba yin no //
analyzed: grangs ma nges pa ni dmigs par bya ba gcig kho nar snang bar 'dod pa la lnga 'am drug tu snang ba yin no //
translated: Uncertainty about number is when one wishes to see only one object, but sees five or six.

original: che chung ma nges pa ni dmigs par bya ba che ba snang bar 'dod pa la chung ba snang ba 'am chung ba snang bar 'dod pa la che ba snang ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: che chung ma nges pa ni dmigs par bya ba che ba snang bar 'dod pa la chung ba snang ba 'am chung ba snang bar 'dod pa la che ba snang ba lta bu'o //
translated: Indeterminate means that the object of meditation is not fixed in size, since a large object appears to one who wishes to see a large object, and a small object appears to one who wishes to see a small object.

original: rtag pa'i don mi snang bar mi rtag pa'i don snang ba'i phyir ma nges pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rtag pa'i don mi snang bar mi rtag pa'i don snang ba'i phyir ma nges pa zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called indeterminate because the meaning of permanence does not appear, but the meaning of impermanence appears.

original: mu bzhi ba ni mu gsum pa las khad par du 'gyur te /
analyzed: mu bzhi ba ni mu gsum pa las khad par du 'gyur te /
translated: The fourth possibility is a combination of the first three.

original: rtsol ba drag zhan gnyis ka la yang snang la /
analyzed: rtsol ba drag zhan gnyis ka la yang snang la /
translated: It is when both strong and weak effort appear,

original: thun rgyang par yang nus /
analyzed: thun rgyang par yang nus /
translated: and one is able to meditate for a long time.

original: mi mthun pa'i chos gnyis dang 'bral zhing mthun pa'i chos gsum dang ldan pa yin no //
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i chos gnyis dang 'bral zhing mthun pa'i chos gsum dang ldan pa yin no //
translated: It is free from the two incompatible qualities and endowed with the three compatible qualities.🔽In the third possibility, one should follow the five indeterminacies.

original: mu gsum pa'i dus su ma nges pa lnga'i rjes su 'brang bar bya ba la yin pa ni gang gi tshe rtsol ba drag zhan gnyis ka la yang mi snang /
analyzed: mu gsum pa'i dus su ma nges pa lnga'i rjes su 'brang bar bya ba la yin pa ni gang gi tshe rtsol ba drag zhan gnyis ka la yang mi snang /
translated: When neither strong nor weak effort appear,

original: thun rkyang bar yang mi nus /
analyzed: thun rkyang bar yang mi nus /
translated: and one is unable to meditate for a long time,

original: res snang res mi snang ba yin pas 'brangs kyang bul med pa yin te /
analyzed: res snang res mi snang ba yin pas 'brangs kyang bul med pa yin te /
translated: sometimes it appears and sometimes it does not.

translated: In the third alternative, in both strong and weak effort, there is a slight abiding in the entity of non-thought, but in some situations, even though one meditates with weak effort, there is no slight abiding in the entity of non-thought.

original: yang kha cig gi dbang du byas na mi rtog pa'i ngo bor mi gnas pa'i ma nges pa drug snang ste /
analyzed: yang kha cig gi dbang du byas na mi rtog pa'i ngo bor mi gnas pa'i ma nges pa drug snang ste /
translated: Again, from the perspective of some, there are six indetermi-nates that do not abide in the entity of non-thought.

original: drug ni kha dog bzhi dang nam mkha' dang / nam mkha' sa phyogs dang bcas pa yin no //
analyzed: drug ni kha dog bzhi dang nam mkha' dang / nam mkha' sa phyogs dang bcas pa yin no //
translated: The six are the four colors, space, and space and the area of space.

original: mu bzhi pa ni mu gsum pa las khyad par du gyur te /
analyzed: mu bzhi pa ni mu gsum pa las khyad par du gyur te /
translated: The fourth alternative is distinguished from the third alternative.

original: chos bzhi dang ldan pa'i mtshan nyid yin no //
analyzed: chos bzhi dang ldan pa'i mtshan nyid yin no //
translated: It is characterized by possessing four dharmas.

original: mu gsum pa'i dus su ma nges pa rnam pa drug gi rjes su 'brang bar bya ba ma yin pa ni gang gi tshe chos thams cad don dam par spros pa'i mtha' brgyad dang bral ba yin pas cir yang mi 'dzin pa ni yang dag pa'i shes pa
analyzed: mu gsum pa'i dus su ma nges pa rnam pa drug gi rjes su 'brang bar bya ba ma yin pa ni gang gi tshe chos thams cad don dam par spros pa'i mtha' brgyad dang bral ba yin pas cir yang mi 'dzin pa ni yang dag pa'i shes pa
translated: The six aspects of the indeterminate that are not to be followed at the time of the third alternative are as follows: When all phenomena are ultimately free from the eight extremes of mental proliferation, not apprehending anything at all is right knowledge.

original: yin no // ma nges pa drug ltar snang ba'i shes pa ni phyin ci log gi shes pa yin te /
analyzed: yin no // ma nges pa drug ltar snang ba'i shes pa ni phyin ci log gi shes pa yin te /
translated: The six indecisions are the six appearances of consciousness, which are mistaken consciousnesses.

original: de bas na de'i tshe mu gsum pa'i dus su ma nges pa rnam pa drug gi rjes su mi 'brang bar shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na de'i tshe mu gsum pa'i dus su ma nges pa rnam pa drug gi rjes su mi 'brang bar shes par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, at that time, during the occasion of the three possibilities, one should understand that one is not following the six types of indecision.

original: yang na chos drug yid la bzhag nas bsgoms pas /
analyzed: yang na chos drug yid la bzhag nas bsgoms pas /
translated: Or else, by meditating on the six topics of mind,

original: sems kyi skye ba'i rim pa bzhir mi 'byung bar cig car cir yang mi 'dzin par 'gyur te /
analyzed: sems kyi skye ba'i rim pa bzhir mi 'byung bar cig car cir yang mi 'dzin par 'gyur te /
translated: the four stages of the arising of the mind do not occur, and one does not apprehend anything at all.

original: thun dang po 'am /
analyzed: thun dang po 'am /
translated: In the first session,

original: zhag drug bdun gyi bar du cir yang mi 'dzin par 'gyur nas gtad du 'dod pa 'am /
analyzed: zhag drug bdun gyi bar du cir yang mi 'dzin par 'gyur nas gtad du 'dod pa 'am /
translated: or for six or seven days, one does not apprehend anything at all.

original: yang na thun mi ring ba tsam du cig car cir yang mi 'dzin par 'gyur nas nyin mtshan gnyis gsum gyi bar du @297b yang nyams par 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: yang na thun mi ring ba tsam du cig car cir yang mi 'dzin par 'gyur nas nyin mtshan gnyis gsum gyi bar du @297b yang nyams par 'gyur zhing /
translated: Or else, for just a short session, one does not apprehend anything at all.

original: yang phyis cig car yang mi 'dzin par gyur nas gtad du 'dod par 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: yang phyis cig car yang mi 'dzin par gyur nas gtad du 'dod par 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: Later, one does not apprehend anything at all, and one wishes to be released.

original: de rim gyis pa 'am cig car ba'i dmigs pa la gtad du 'dod pa'i mtshan nyid ni chos bzhi dang ldan pa yin no //
analyzed: de rim gyis pa 'am cig car ba'i dmigs pa la gtad du 'dod pa'i mtshan nyid ni chos bzhi dang ldan pa yin no //
translated: The definition of the desire to focus on the object either gradually or instantaneously is to possess four attributes.

original: dmigs pa la gtad du 'dod pa'i gsal ba'i bye brag ni rab 'bring tha mar shes par bya ste /
analyzed: dmigs pa la gtad du 'dod pa'i gsal ba'i bye brag ni rab 'bring tha mar shes par bya ste /
translated: The specific clarity of the desire to focus on the object should be understood as being of three types: best, middling and least.

original: rab ni mi rtog pa'i mthu yang shin tu che la shes pa'i rgyud kyang shin tu gsal ba yin no //
analyzed: rab ni mi rtog pa'i mthu yang shin tu che la shes pa'i rgyud kyang shin tu gsal ba yin no //
translated: The best is when the power of non-conceptuality is very great and the continuum of consciousness is also very clear.

original: 'bring ni mi rtog pa'i mthu yang 'bring la shes pa'i rgyud kyang gsal ba 'bring tsam du gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: 'bring ni mi rtog pa'i mthu yang 'bring la shes pa'i rgyud kyang gsal ba 'bring tsam du gnas pa yin no //
translated: The middling is when the power of non-conceptuality is middling and the continuum of consciousness remains as just a middling clarity.

original: tha ma ni mi rtog pa'i mthu yang chung la shes pa'i rgyud kyang snga ma bas cung zad tsam mi gsal ba yin no //
analyzed: tha ma ni mi rtog pa'i mthu yang chung la shes pa'i rgyud kyang snga ma bas cung zad tsam mi gsal ba yin no //
translated: The least is when the power of non-conceptuality is small and the continuum of consciousness is slightly less clear than the previous.

original: rab 'bring tha mar shes nas dmigs pa la gtad du 'dod pa'i dus su gang nyams su myong yang chog shes par byas nas brtan pa'i cho ga byas na khams mi bde bar mi 'gyur ba dang / phyis mi nyams par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rab 'bring tha mar shes nas dmigs pa la gtad du 'dod pa'i dus su gang nyams su myong yang chog shes par byas nas brtan pa'i cho ga byas na khams mi bde bar mi 'gyur ba dang / phyis mi nyams par 'gyur ro //
translated: When one knows the superior, middling, and inferior, and at the time of wishing to focus on the object, whatever experience one has, one should be satisfied with it and perform the rite of stabilization. Then one will not become unwell and later one will not degenerate.

original: 'bring dang tha mas chog ma shes nas rtsol ba drag tu cir yang mi 'dzin par bsgoms shing brtan pa'i cho ga ma byas pas khams mi bde bar 'gyur ba dang / phyis nyams par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'bring dang tha mas chog ma shes nas rtsol ba drag tu cir yang mi 'dzin par bsgoms shing brtan pa'i cho ga ma byas pas khams mi bde bar 'gyur ba dang / phyis nyams par 'gyur ro //
translated: If one does not know satisfaction with the middling and inferior, and one meditates without holding anything whatsoever with intense effort, and one does not perform the rite of stabilization, one will become unwell and later one will degenerate.

original: dbang po rno rtul dang / thos pa che chung dang / khams rab 'bring tha ma la rim gyis pa dang / cig car ba dang / gsal ba'i bye brag rab 'bring tha ma las gang 'byung ma nges par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: dbang po rno rtul dang / thos pa che chung dang / khams rab 'bring tha ma la rim gyis pa dang / cig car ba dang / gsal ba'i bye brag rab 'bring tha ma las gang 'byung ma nges par shes par bya'o //
translated: One should know that it is uncertain which will occur: whether one has sharp or dull faculties, whether one has much or little learning, and whether one is gradual or instantaneous, and whether one has the superior, middling, or inferior clarity.

original: de la chos brgyad shes shing ldan par byas nas bsgoms pa'i stobs kyis dmigs pa la gtad du 'dod par gyur na brtan pa'i cho ga ni chos bzhi'i dbang gis bye brag dgur shes na skyon spangs shing yon tan dang ldan pas phyis mi nyams par 'gyur te
analyzed: de la chos brgyad shes shing ldan par byas nas bsgoms pa'i stobs kyis dmigs pa la gtad du 'dod par gyur na brtan pa'i cho ga ni chos bzhi'i dbang gis bye brag dgur shes na skyon spangs shing yon tan dang ldan pas phyis mi nyams par 'gyur te
translated: Having understood and possessed the eight dharmas, when one desires to focus on the object through the power of meditation, the rite of stability is as follows: If one knows the nine distinctions through the power of the four dharmas, one will abandon faults and possess qualities, and later will not degenerate.

original: de la chos bzhi ni khams rab 'bring tha ma dang dmigs pa la gtad du 'dod par byed pa'i dus su mi bde ba med pa dang / cung zad mi bde ba dang / rab 'bring tha ma mi dmigs pa la gtad du 'dod par byed pa'i dus su cher mi bde bar 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: de la chos bzhi ni khams rab 'bring tha ma dang dmigs pa la gtad du 'dod par byed pa'i dus su mi bde ba med pa dang / cung zad mi bde ba dang / rab 'bring tha ma mi dmigs pa la gtad du 'dod par byed pa'i dus su cher mi bde bar 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: The four dharmas are: when focusing on the object, there is no discomfort, slight discomfort, and great discomfort when desiring to focus on the object of the best, medium, and least [faculties].

original: de bye brag dgu ni rab la gsum /
analyzed: de bye brag dgu ni rab la gsum /
translated: The nine distinctions are: three for the best,

original: 'bring la gsum /
analyzed: 'bring la gsum /
translated: three for the medium,

original: tha ma la gsum mo //
analyzed: tha ma la gsum mo //
translated: and three for the least.

original: de la rab gsum ni dmigs pa la gtad du 'dod par byed pa'i dus su ye mi bde ba med na nyin mtshan drug tu ci nus su bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: de la rab gsum ni dmigs pa la gtad du 'dod par byed pa'i dus su ye mi bde ba med na nyin mtshan drug tu ci nus su bsgom par bya'o //
translated: Among them, the three for the best are: if there is absolutely no discomfort when desiring to focus on the object, one should meditate for six days and nights to the best of one's ability.

original: rab de cung zad mi bde bar gyur na nyin mtshan bzhir ci nus su bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: rab de cung zad mi bde bar gyur na nyin mtshan bzhir ci nus su bsgom par bya'o //
translated: If the best person becomes slightly uncomfortable, he should meditate for four days and nights to the best of his ability.

original: rab de cher mi bde bar gyur pa dang / dmigs pa dus mtshungs su snang na brtan pa'i cho ga bya mi dgos par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: rab de cher mi bde bar gyur pa dang / dmigs pa dus mtshungs su snang na brtan pa'i cho ga bya mi dgos par shes par bya'o //
translated: If the best person becomes very uncomfortable and the object appears at the same time, one should understand that the rite of stabilization is not necessary.

original: 'bring la gsum ni /
analyzed: 'bring la gsum ni /
translated: The medium person has three [types].

original: dmigs pa la gtad du 'dod par byed pa'i dus su /
analyzed: dmigs pa la gtad du 'dod par byed pa'i dus su /
translated: When he wishes to direct himself to the object,

original: ye mi bde ba med na nyin mtshan bzhir ci nus su bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: ye mi bde ba med na nyin mtshan bzhir ci nus su bsgom par bya'o //
translated: if he is not at all uncomfortable, he should meditate for four days and nights to the best of his ability.

original: @298a * // 'bring de cung zad mi bde bar gyur na nyin mtshan gnyis su ci nus su bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: @298a * // 'bring de cung zad mi bde bar gyur na nyin mtshan gnyis su ci nus su bsgom par bya'o //
translated: If the medium person becomes slightly uncomfortable, he should meditate for two days and nights to the best of his ability.

original: 'bring de cher mi bde bar gyur pa dang dmigs pa dus mtshungs su snang na brtan pa'i cho ga ye mi dgos par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: 'bring de cher mi bde bar gyur pa dang dmigs pa dus mtshungs su snang na brtan pa'i cho ga ye mi dgos par shes par bya'o //
translated: If the medium person becomes very uncomfortable and the object appears at the same time, one should understand that the rite of stabilization is not necessary at all.

original: chos bzhi'i dbang gis khams tha ma la gsum ni khams tha ma de dmigs pa la gtad du 'dod par byed pa'i dus su mi bde ba ye med na nyin mtshan gnyis su ci nus su bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: chos bzhi'i dbang gis khams tha ma la gsum ni khams tha ma de dmigs pa la gtad du 'dod par byed pa'i dus su mi bde ba ye med na nyin mtshan gnyis su ci nus su bsgom par bya'o //
translated: By means of the four dharmas, when the final constituent is not at all uncomfortable at the time of being directed to the object of observation, one should meditate with all one’s strength for two days and nights.

original: khams tha ma de cung zad mi bde bar gyur na snga so'i bsgoms pa tsam nyin mtshan gnyis nas gsum du bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: khams tha ma de cung zad mi bde bar gyur na snga so'i bsgoms pa tsam nyin mtshan gnyis nas gsum du bsgom par bya'o //
translated: When that final constituent is slightly uncomfortable, one should meditate for two or three days and nights just as before.

original: khams tha ma de cher mi bde bar gyur ba dang dmigs pa dus mtshungs su snang na brtan pa'i cho ga ye mi dgos par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: khams tha ma de cher mi bde bar gyur ba dang dmigs pa dus mtshungs su snang na brtan pa'i cho ga ye mi dgos par shes par bya'o //
translated: When that final constituent becomes very uncomfortable and the object of observation appears simultaneously, one should understand that there is no need for the rite of stability.

original: skyon spang zhing yon tan dang ldan pa ni khams mi bde bar 'gyur ba dang / dmigs pa mi gsal bar 'gyur ba dang / dmigs pa nyams par 'gyur ba'i skyon rnams spangs shing yon tan gsum dang ldan te khams mi bde bar mi 'gyur ba dang /
analyzed: skyon spang zhing yon tan dang ldan pa ni khams mi bde bar 'gyur ba dang / dmigs pa mi gsal bar 'gyur ba dang / dmigs pa nyams par 'gyur ba'i skyon rnams spangs shing yon tan gsum dang ldan te khams mi bde bar mi 'gyur ba dang /
translated: Abandoning faults and possessing good qualities means abandoning the faults of becoming uncomfortable, of the object of observation becoming unclear, and of the object of observation being lost, and possessing the three good qualities of not becoming uncomfortable,

original: dmigs pa mi gsal bar mi 'gyur ba dang / dmigs pa nyams par mi 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: dmigs pa mi gsal bar mi 'gyur ba dang / dmigs pa nyams par mi 'gyur ba'o //
translated: It does not become unclear, and it does not deteriorate.

original: de bas na mi nyams shing brtan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bas na mi nyams shing brtan par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, it is not lost, and it becomes firm.🔽When he wishes to direct his attention to the object, he does so by the power of his firm resolve, which is the result of his firm grounding.

original: de dmigs pa la gtad du 'dod par gyur nas brtan pa'i cho gas brtan par byas pa'i dbang gis phyis dmigs pa la gtad du 'dod pa de ni gzhi gnas kyi phyogs dang mthun pa zhes bya ste ;
analyzed: de dmigs pa la gtad du 'dod par gyur nas brtan pa'i cho gas brtan par byas pa'i dbang gis phyis dmigs pa la gtad du 'dod pa de ni gzhi gnas kyi phyogs dang mthun pa zhes bya ste ;
translated: This is called the side of stability.

original: zhi gnas rdzogs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: zhi gnas rdzogs pa ma yin no //
translated: He has not yet perfected serenity.

original: de la zhi gnas kyi phyogs dang mthun pa thob nas kyang chos gsum shes shing ldan na zhi gnas rdzogs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de la zhi gnas kyi phyogs dang mthun pa thob nas kyang chos gsum shes shing ldan na zhi gnas rdzogs par 'gyur te /
translated: However, when he has attained the side of stability and possesses three qualities, he will perfect serenity.

original: chos gsum ni mu bzhir shes shing blang dor gyi bye brag shes pa dang zhi gnas kyi rgyu drug dang ldan zhing de'i mi mthun pa spang bar bya ba dang / bsgom pa tshod zin zhing thun ring po ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: chos gsum ni mu bzhir shes shing blang dor gyi bye brag shes pa dang zhi gnas kyi rgyu drug dang ldan zhing de'i mi mthun pa spang bar bya ba dang / bsgom pa tshod zin zhing thun ring po ma yin pa'o //
translated: The three qualities are: knowing the four limits, knowing the distinctions of what is to be adopted and what is to be rejected, and possessing the six causes of serenity and avoiding their six obstructions, meditating appropriately, and not in long sessions.

original: de la mu bzhir shes shing blang dor gyi bye brag shes pa ni ting nge 'dzin ma rdzogs pa'i dbang gis sems kyi nyams mu bzhir 'byung bar shes par bya ste /
analyzed: de la mu bzhir shes shing blang dor gyi bye brag shes pa ni ting nge 'dzin ma rdzogs pa'i dbang gis sems kyi nyams mu bzhir 'byung bar shes par bya ste /
translated: One should understand the four possibilities of this, and the specific distinctions of what is to be adopted and what is to be rejected, as the arising of the four experiences of the mind due to the incompleteness of samādhi.

original: mu dang po la ni dmigs pa mi gsal la rgod pa yod pa dang / mu gnyis pa la ni dmigs pa mi gsal la rgod pa med pa dang / mu gsum pa la ni dmigs pa 'bring tsam la rgod pa yod pa dang / mu bzhi pa ni dmigs pa shin tu gsal la rgod pa med pa yin no //
analyzed: mu dang po la ni dmigs pa mi gsal la rgod pa yod pa dang / mu gnyis pa la ni dmigs pa mi gsal la rgod pa med pa dang / mu gsum pa la ni dmigs pa 'bring tsam la rgod pa yod pa dang / mu bzhi pa ni dmigs pa shin tu gsal la rgod pa med pa yin no //
translated: In the first possibility, there is agitation but the object of meditation is not clear. In the second possibility, there is no agitation but the object of meditation is not clear. In the third possibility, there is agitation but the object of meditation is somewhat clear. In the fourth possibility, there is no agitation and the object of meditation is very clear.

original: mu dang po ni rnal 'byor ba'i shes pa'i rgyu nus pa chung ba'i dus na 'byung ngo //
analyzed: mu dang po ni rnal 'byor ba'i shes pa'i rgyu nus pa chung ba'i dus na 'byung ngo //
translated: The first possibility occurs when the power of the cause of the yogin’s consciousness is weak.

original: mu gnyis pa ni bying ba shas che ba'i dus na 'byung ngo //
analyzed: mu gnyis pa ni bying ba shas che ba'i dus na 'byung ngo //
translated: The second possibility occurs when laxity is predominant.

original: mu gsum @298b pa ni shes pa'i rgyu nus pa 'bring gi dus na 'byung la nus pa che ba yin na yang sgom snying mi 'dod pa'i dus na 'byung ngo //
analyzed: mu gsum @298b pa ni shes pa'i rgyu nus pa 'bring gi dus na 'byung la nus pa che ba yin na yang sgom snying mi 'dod pa'i dus na 'byung ngo //
translated: The third possibility occurs when the power of the cause of consciousness is middling, and even when it is strong, it occurs when one does not wish to meditate.

original: mu bzhi pa ni shes pa'i rgyu yang nus pa che la /
analyzed: mu bzhi pa ni shes pa'i rgyu yang nus pa che la /
translated: The fourth possibility is that the cause of consciousness is strong,

original: sgom snying 'dod pa'i dus na 'byung ngo //
analyzed: sgom snying 'dod pa'i dus na 'byung ngo //
translated: and it occurs when one wishes to meditate.

original: blang dor gyi bye brag shes pa ni ting nge 'dzin ma rdzogs pa'i dbang gis sems kyi nyams mu bzhir 'byung ste /
analyzed: blang dor gyi bye brag shes pa ni ting nge 'dzin ma rdzogs pa'i dbang gis sems kyi nyams mu bzhir 'byung ste /
translated: The knowledge of the specific distinctions of what to adopt and what to discard is the arising of the four possibilities of the experience of the mind due to the power of incomplete samādhi.

original: de ltar 'byung bar shes na blang dor gyi bye brag shugs kyis shes pa 'byung ste /
analyzed: de ltar 'byung bar shes na blang dor gyi bye brag shugs kyis shes pa 'byung ste /
translated: If one knows that they arise in that way, the knowledge of the specific distinctions of what to adopt and what to discard arises implicitly.

original: de la mi lcogs pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi mtshan nyid ni sems shin tu gsal ba yin /
analyzed: de la mi lcogs pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi mtshan nyid ni sems shin tu gsal ba yin /
translated: The definition of the samādhi of no more learning is a very clear mind.

original: bying rgod gnyis dang bral ba yin no //
analyzed: bying rgod gnyis dang bral ba yin no //
translated: It is free from both dullness and agitation.

original: tshor ba btang snyoms dang ldan pa yin pas /
analyzed: tshor ba btang snyoms dang ldan pa yin pas /
translated: It is endowed with the sensation of equanimity.

original: de bas na mu bzhi ba la mi lugs pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi phyogs dang mthun pa shas che ba yin pas /
analyzed: de bas na mu bzhi ba la mi lugs pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi phyogs dang mthun pa shas che ba yin pas /
translated: Therefore, since the fourth possibility is mostly in accord with the samādhi of no more learning,

original: mu gsum pa'i dus su rtsol ba bya zhing spang bar bya'o //
analyzed: mu gsum pa'i dus su rtsol ba bya zhing spang bar bya'o //
translated: at the time of the third possibility, one should apply effort and discard it.

original: mu bzhi pa'i dus su ngang la ma shor bar bya zhing de la gus par bya'o //
analyzed: mu bzhi pa'i dus su ngang la ma shor bar bya zhing de la gus par bya'o //
translated: At the time of the fourth possibility, one should not lose the continuity and respect it.

original: ting nge 'dzin ma rdzogs pa'i dbang gis sems kyi nyams mu bzhir 'byung ste /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin ma rdzogs pa'i dbang gis sems kyi nyams mu bzhir 'byung ste /
translated: Because of the incompleteness of concentration, four kinds of mental states arise.

original: de ltar 'byung bar mi shes na /
analyzed: de ltar 'byung bar mi shes na /
translated: If one does not know how they arise,

original: blang dor gyi bye brag shes par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: blang dor gyi bye brag shes par mi 'gyur te /
translated: one will not know the distinctions of what to adopt and what to discard.

original: de bas na ting nge 'dzin rdzogs par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bas na ting nge 'dzin rdzogs par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, concentration will not be completed.

original: ting nge 'dzin ma rdzogs pa'i dbang gis sems kyi nyams mu bzhir 'byung ste /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin ma rdzogs pa'i dbang gis sems kyi nyams mu bzhir 'byung ste /
translated: Because of the incompleteness of concentration, four kinds of mental states arise.

original: de ltar 'byung bar shes na blang dor gyi bye brag shugs kyis shes par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar 'byung bar shes na blang dor gyi bye brag shugs kyis shes par 'gyur te /
translated: If one knows how they arise, one will automatically know the distinctions of what to adopt and what to discard.

original: de lta bas na ting nge 'dzin myur du rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta bas na ting nge 'dzin myur du rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, concentration will be quickly completed.

original: zhi gnas kyi rgyu drug dang ldan zhing de'i mi mthun pa spong ba ni /
analyzed: zhi gnas kyi rgyu drug dang ldan zhing de'i mi mthun pa spong ba ni /
translated: The six causes of serenity and the abandonment of their opposites

original: zhi gnas kyi rgyu drug mthun pa'i yul na gnas pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: zhi gnas kyi rgyu drug mthun pa'i yul na gnas pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: are living in a conducive place, and so forth.

original: zhi gnas kyi rgyu drug shes par byas nas /
analyzed: zhi gnas kyi rgyu drug shes par byas nas /
translated: Having understood the six causes of serenity,

original: rgyud la ldan par bya zhing /
analyzed: rgyud la ldan par bya zhing /
translated: one should possess them in one’s mindstream

original: mi mthun pa'i yul na gnas pa la sogs pa spang bar bya'o //
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i yul na gnas pa la sogs pa spang bar bya'o //
translated: and abandon living in a place that is not conducive, and so forth.

original: zhi gnas kyi rgya drug dang mi ldan zhing de'i mi mthun pa mi spang ba ni /
analyzed: zhi gnas kyi rgya drug dang mi ldan zhing de'i mi mthun pa mi spang ba ni /
translated: Not to have the six causes of serenity and to not abandon their opposites

original: dor bar bya ba'i mu gsum pa ni phal cher 'byung zhing /

original: sgom pa tshod zin thun ring min la mkhas //
analyzed: sgom pa tshod zin thun ring min la mkhas //
